intro: Ammi rubricaule, commonly known as the red-stemmed cow-wheat, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, often fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodland areas. Its seeds are dispersed by wind, contributing to its spread in suitable habitats.
